pullRequest.title: EntityTypes
pullRequest.bodyText: Includes a new module, intended to hold vanilla bugfixes and other odd behavior changes to Vanilla behavior that Forge makes and mods rely on. This is better than keeping the bugfixes in their own modules because it encourages developers to make their fixes in ways that will not conflict with other mods (i.e. Patchwork modules). This will also aid in updating because we can just go down the list of bugs in one place, instead of searching the entire Patchwork codebase.

nodes.bodyText: This is an unrelated fix, this package name didn't match the ones used everywhere else.

commit.message: Remove TODO involving potential mixin conflicts

nodes.bodyText: No? com.patchworkmc.mixin.extensions.shearing is what all of the shearing mixins use, and MinecraftForge uses net.minecraftforge.common.extensions. The only exception is MixinStatusEffect. If you want to rename all of the other patchwork packages, fine, but this is only halfway. I think this refactor makes sense for another PR. I'm still split if extension or extensions makes more sense for the package name: Forge uses extensions, and most of patchwork uses extensions.
Is the interface needed here? I don't think this is ever accessed externally.
I generally put a blank line between headers and content.
Generally I use softwrap for markdown, and don't manually wrap lines.

nodes.bodyText: After some discussion in #mixin, I don't think that this will work in production, since it doesn't get remapped. We'll need another approach perhaps.

commit.message:
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:PatchworkMC/patchwork-api into feature/entitytypes

 Conflicts:
	patchwork-registries/src/main/java/com/patchworkmc/mixin/registries/MixinEntityType.java
	patchwork-registries/src/main/resources/patchwork-registries.mixins.json
Use @Redirect instead of a weird intrinsic displacement + update license headers

nodes.bodyText: Note that setCustomClientFactory will be handled by the networking module.

+
+import net.minecraft.entity.Entity;
+import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType;
+
+/**
+ * Forge does this through patching the constructor instead, we just add methods with mixins instead.
+ */
+public interface PatchworkEntityTypeBuilderExtensions<T extends Entity> {
+	EntityType.Builder<T> setUpdateInterval(int interval);
+
+	EntityType.Builder<T> setTrackingRange(int range);
+
+	EntityType.Builder<T> setShouldReceiveVelocityUpdates(boolean value);
+
+	// TODO: setCustomClientFactory
